news.title: Father of two stabbed to death in spiralling Dublin feud had no involvement in violence
news.summary: A football club captain who was stabbed to death as part of a spiralling Dublin dispute had no involvement in the feud violence.

news.title: New anti-fraud system is labelling hospital texts and other legitimate messages as ‘likely scam’
news.summary: Ireland’s new crackdown on scam texts is labelling real texts as fraudulent – leading to confusion over hospital appointments, digital verification codes and sports tickets.

news.title: ‘We're getting close to finding several countries’ – Netanyahu and Trump on the ‘free choice’ relocation of Palestinians
news.summary: U.S. President Donald Trump, hosting Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at the White House on Monday, said the United States had scheduled talks with Iran and indicated progress on a controversial effort to relocate Palestinians out of Gaza.

news.title: Exposed: The savage reality of dog attacks as farmers say ‘enough’
news.summary: It started with a farmer in West Kerry, tears running down his face. “He told me his sheep had been chased off the cliffs. Broken legs. Lambs gone,” says John Joe Fitzgerald, Vice President of the Irish Natura and Hill Farmers Association (INHFA). “That moment really affected me.”

news.title: VIP packages priced at €2,000 being sold for former US president Barack Obama’s live Dublin interview at 3Arena
news.summary: VIP packages priced at €2,000 are being sold for former US president Barack Obama’s live interview in Dublin later this year.

news.title: Colm Keys: Robert Doyle’s goal-line heroics saved the GAA’s blushes as well as All-Ireland hopes for Tipperary
news.summary: The referee’s report of a football or hurling game is final. His or her declaration of something within that report doesn’t just carry most weight, it carries all of the weight. Unless there is incontrovertible evidence to the contrary.

news.title: The Indo Daily: The bankrupt Dublin Jeweller, the fake gems and the missing diamonds
news.summary: A customer of a Dublin-based jeweller is “disappointed but not surprised” to learn that a €3,000 emerald and diamond ring she purchased contains fake gemstones.

news.title: Everything you need to know about the potential runners and riders in Ireland’s race for the presidency
news.summary: Sinn Féin leader Mary Lou McDonald has opened the door to contesting the presidential election in a move that could recast what had been billed as a lacklustre campaign.

news.title: ‘The right of way to our house is becoming unusable and the owner is ignoring us. Can we do the maintenance on the laneway ourselves?’
news.summary: Query: Myself and my wife are writing to ask for some guidance on a matter that’s been bothering us. We have a legal right of way over a neighbouring field that gives us access to the public road.

news.title: The ultimate guide to getting through a heatwave in Ireland
news.summary: Ireland has managed to evade the blisteringly hot temperatures observed around Europe last week, but forecasts indicate that we are on course to experience a heatwave of our own.
